content: astrid s diagonals sample the tutorials this diagonals sample has video tutorials on youtube please note that it is made assuming you know the basics of interlocking crochet if you are new to the technique you may want to first check my christmas tangle tutorials astrid1s diagonals sample 2 tutorials astrid s christmas tangle potholder 5 tutorials astrid s youtube channel astrid s interlocking crochet © astrid schandy 2024 aschandy@yahoo no astrid s diagonals sample 1 the technique these potholders are made in crochet the technique is interlocking crochet basically two filet/mesh crochet parts of double_crochet - chain one which are interlinked to form a pattern or drawing each row is worked first on one colour and then with the next before the work is turned around at the very end of this file i have added information on this technique as well as a photo guide on how to start a project it is added at the end so that if you already know the technique you can avoid printing the last pages the size the finished sample measures approximately 16 x 16 cm if you want it in a larger size using a thicker yarn and a larger needle would be the solution the yarn one sample takes approximately 35 grams the colour a is the one used in the border and the pattern orange in photo approx 17gr and the colour b is the colour used in the background white 16gr i used scheepjes catona 100% cotton mercerized fingering weight 125metres per 50gr and used a 3 0mm hook though the suggested hook for this yarn is 3 5mm my choice of colours is included at the start of the pattern table the basic stitches us terminology chain chain the pattern is abbreviated to skip skip make it simple to read it consists b1 dcib ch1 double_crochet double_crochet of b s and f s with a number next b3 dcib ch1 x3 times dcib double_crochet in the back to it to the right is the f1 dcif ch1 dcif double_crochet in the front explanation of the abbreviations f2 dcif ch1 twice single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet diagonal stitches see section below row ends note the b row end with b or f stitches however the last stitch does not have a chain 1 i always end all row with chain 3 instead of doing it at the beginning of the next it is just a habit and it is easier to hang the b colour back or front at the start of an a row the last stitch of a and b row goes in the last window of the previous row and not in a specific chain eventually with a little tug the sides have square windows © astrid schandy 2024 aschandy@yahoo no astrid s
